clinical_study.brief_title: Assessing Neuropsychiatric Symptoms Including Depression, Anxiety, Irritability, and Suicidal Thoughts or Behavior in Subjects Quitting Smoking on Varenicline Tartrate or Placebo
clinical_study.official_title: An Experimental Medicine, Randomized, Double-Blind Study Assessing Neuropsychiatric Symptoms In Quitting Smokers Treated With Varenicline Tartrate Or Placebo

brief_summary.textblock: Study objective is to compare neuropsychiatric adverse events in subjects treated with varenicline or placebo in a controlled setting where both groups are experiencing nicotine withdrawal.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Profile of Mood States (POMS): Total Mood Disturbance (TMD)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
primary_outcome.description: POMS TMD were responses to 65 items in 6 subscales (Tension-Anxiety, Depression-Dejection, Anger-Hostility, Vigor, Fatigue, and Confusion), on 'How you feel right now?' (scale:0=not at all, 1=a little, 2=moderately, 3=quite a bit, 4=extremely). All items were rated in the same direction except for Relaxed and Efficient in the Tension-Anxiety and Confusion subscales. TMD was the sum of the scores of all 6 subscales but weighting Vigor negatively. Summary results (TMD scores) were presented as transformed T-scores ranging from 30 (less disturbance) to 80 (more disturbance).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Profile of Mood States (POMS): Tension-Anxiety Subscale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
primary_outcome.description: POMS Tension-Anxiety subscale data were responses to 9 items regarding 'How you feel right now?' on a scale of 0=not at all, 1=a little, 2=moderately, 3=quite a bit, and 4=extremely. All items were rated in the same direction except for Relaxed. Summary results (subscale scores) were presented as transformed T-scores ranging from 30 (less disturbance) to 80 (more disturbance).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Profile of Mood States (POMS): Depression-Dejection Subscale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
primary_outcome.description: POMS Depression-Dejection subscale data responses to 15 items regarding 'How you feel right now?' on a scale of 0=not at all, 1=a little, 2=moderately, 3=quite a bit, and 4=extremely. Summary results (subscale scores) were presented as transformed T-scores ranging from 30 (less disturbance) to 80 (more disturbance).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Profile of Mood States (POMS): Anger-Hostility Subscale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
primary_outcome.description: POMS Anger-Hostility subscale data were responses to 12 items regarding 'How you feel right now?' on a scale of 0=not at all, 1=a little, 2=moderately, 3=quite a bit, and 4=extremely. Summary results (subscale scores) were presented as transformed T-scores ranging from 30 (less disturbance) to 80 (more disturbance).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Profile of Mood States (POMS): Vigor Subscale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
primary_outcome.description: POMS Vigor subscale data were responses to 8 items regarding 'How you feel right now?' on a scale of 0=not at all, 1=a little, 2=moderately, 3=quite a bit, and 4=extremely. Summary results (subscale scores) were presented as transformed T-scores ranging from 30 (less disturbance) to 80 (more disturbance).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Profile of Mood States (POMS): Fatigue Subscale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
primary_outcome.description: POMS Fatigue subscale data were responses to 7 items regarding 'How you feel right now?' on a scale of 0=not at all, 1=a little, 2=moderately, 3=quite a bit, and 4=extremely. All items were rated in the same direction. Summary results (subscale scores) were presented as transformed T-scores ranging from 30 (less disturbance) to 80 (more disturbance).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Profile of Mood States (POMS): Confusion Subscale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
primary_outcome.description: POMS Confusion subscale data were responses to 7 items regarding 'How you feel right now?' on a scale of 0=not at all, 1=a little, 2=moderately, 3=quite a bit, and 4=extremely. All items were rated in the same direction except for Efficient. Summary results (subscale scores) were presented as transformed T-scores ranging from 30 (less disturbance) to 80 (more disturbance).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS): Total Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
primary_outcome.description: The MADRS measures the overall severity of depressive symptoms and is a 10-item checklist. Each item was rated on a scale of 0 to 6, for a total score range of 0 (low severity of depressive symptoms) to 60 (high severity of depressive symptoms).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Hamilton Anxiety Scale (HAM-A): Total Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
primary_outcome.description: HAM-A measures treatment-related changes in generalized anxiety symptoms and is a 14-item questionnaire. Each item was scored from 0 (not present) to 4 (very severe) and a lower score indicated less affected. Total scores ranged from 0 (not affected) to 56 (very severely affected).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Overt Aggression Scale (Modified) (OAS-m): Aggression Total Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
primary_outcome.description: The OAS-m contains 3 scales: Aggression (Questions [Q]1 to 4), Irritability (Q5 to 6), and Suicidality (Q7 to 7b). Aggression total score was calculated by summing the weighted scores in Q1 to 4. Scores for each question ranged from 0 (no events) to 5 (very severe events). Total scores ranged from 0 (no aggression) to any number with no upper limit depending on the frequency of agressive behaviour in a week.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Overt Aggression Scale (Modified) (OAS-m): Irritability Total Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
primary_outcome.description: The OAS-m contains 3 scales: Aggression (Questions [Q]1 to 4), Irritability (Q5 to 6), and Suicidality (Q7 to 7b). Irritability total score was calculated by summing the items in Q5 to 6. Scores for each question ranged from 0 (not at all) to 5 (extreme). Total scores ranged from 0 (no irritability) to 10 (extreme irritability).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Overt Aggression Scale (Modified) (OAS-m): Suicidality Total Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
primary_outcome.description: The OAS-m contains 3 scales: Aggression (Questions [Q]1 to 4), Irritability (Q5 to 6), and Suicidality (Q7 to 7b). Suicidality total score was calculated by summing the items Q7 to 7b. Scores for Q7 ranged from 0 (none) to 6 (very extreme) and scores for Q7a to 7b ranged from 0 (none) to 5 (extreme). Total scores ranged from 0 (no suicidal tendency) to 16 (extreme/very extreme suicidal tendency).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Social Dysfunction and Aggression Scale (SDAS): Total Score
primary_outcome.description: The SDAS contains 11 items with 5 possible responses: 0=not present, 1=doubtful or very mild, 2=mild to moderate, 3=severe, and 4=extremely severe. The SDAS was collected 3 times a day during the inpatient abstinence period (BC). Total scores ranged from 0 (not present) to 44 (extremely severe).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Barratt Impulsiveness Scale - Version 11 (BIS-11): Total Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
primary_outcome.description: The BIS-11 is a 30-item self-report questionnaire designed to assess general impulsiveness taking into account the multifactorial nature of the construct. Possible responses to each item were: 1=rarely/never, 2=occasionally, 3=often, and 4=almost always/always. Scores of Items 1, 7, 8, 9, 10, 12, 13, 15, 20, 29 and 30 were reversed when calculating the total score. Total score ranged from 30 (less impulsive) to 120 (more impulsive).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Minnesota Nicotine Withdrawal Scale (MNWS): Total Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
secondary_outcome.description: The MNWS total score contains 9 items (urge to smoke; depressed mood; irritability, frustration, or anger; anxiety; difficulty concentrating; restlessness; increased appetite; difficulty going to sleep; difficulty staying asleep). Each item was rated from 0 to 4 where 0=not at all, 1=slight, 2=moderate, 3=quite a bit, and 4=extreme. Total scores were the average score for all 9 items and ranged from 0 (no withdrawal symptoms) to 4 (extreme withdrawal symptoms).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Minnesota Nicotine Withdrawal Scale (MNWS): Negative Affect Domain Subscale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
secondary_outcome.description: The MNWS negative affect domain subscale contains 4 items (depressed mood; irritability, frustration, or anger; anxiety; difficulty concentrating). Each item was rated from 0 to 4 where 0=not at all, 1=slight, 2=moderate, 3=quite a bit, and 4=extreme. Scores were the average from all 4 items and ranged from 0 (no negative affect) to 4 (extreme negative affect).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Minnesota Nicotine Withdrawal Scale (MNWS): Insomnia Domain Subscale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
secondary_outcome.description: The MNWS insomnia domain subscale contains 2 items (difficulty going to sleep; difficulty staying asleep). Each item was rated from 0 to 4 where 0=not at all, 1=slight, 2=moderate, 3=quite a bit, and 4=extreme. Scores were the average of the 2 items and ranged from 0 (no insomnia) to 4 (extreme insomnia).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Minnesota Nicotine Withdrawal Scale (MNWS): Urge to Smoke Subscale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
secondary_outcome.description: The MNWS urge to smoke subscale contains 1 item (urge to smoke) rated from 0 to 4 where 0=not at all, 1=slight, 2=moderate, 3=quite a bit, and 4=extreme. Scores ranged from 0 (no urge to smoke) to 4 (extreme urge to smoke).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Minnesota Nicotine Withdrawal Scale (MNWS): Restlessness Subscale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
secondary_outcome.description: The MNWS restlessness subscale contains 1 item (restlessness) rated from 0 to 4 where 0=not at all, 1=slight, 2=moderate, 3=quite a bit, and 4=extreme. Scores ranged from 0 (no restlessness) to 4 (extreme restlessness).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Minnesota Nicotine Withdrawal Scale (MNWS): Increased Appetite Subscale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
secondary_outcome.description: The MNWS increased appetite subscale contains 1 item (increased appetite) rated from 0 to 4 where 0=not at all, 1=slight, 2=moderate, 3=quite a bit, and 4=extreme. Scores ranged from 0 (no increased appetite) to 4 (extreme increased appetite).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Exceeding Thresholds for the Profile of Mood States (POMS): Total Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
secondary_outcome.description: POMS total mood disturbance (TMD) summary results were presented as transformed T-scores ranging from 30 (less disturbance) to 80 (more disturbance). Participants exceeding the threshold had an increase from baseline of 1 standard deviation of the TMD baseline T-score plus 1 or more.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Exceeding Thresholds for the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS): Total Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
secondary_outcome.description: The MADRS measures the overall severity of depressive symptoms. Total score ranged from 0 (low severity of depressive symptoms) to 60 (high severity of depressive symptoms). Participants exceeding the threshold had a MADRS total score of more than 14 out of 60. MADRS total scores exceeding 14 may represent clinically notable effective symptomatology.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Exceeding Thresholds for the Hamilton Anxiety Scale (HAM-A): Total Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
secondary_outcome.description: HAM-A measures treatment-related changes in generalized anxiety symptoms. Total scores ranged from 0 (not affected) to 56 (very severely affected). Participants exceeding the threshold had a HAM-A total score of more than or equal to 14 out of 56. HAM-A total scores of more than or equal to 14 may reflect clinically noteworthy levels of anxiety.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Exceeding Thresholds for the Overt Aggression Scale (Modified) (OAS-m): Agression Total Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
secondary_outcome.description: The OAS-m contains 3 scales: Aggression, Irritability, and Suicidality. Aggression total score ranged from 0 (no aggression) to any number with no upper limit depending on the frequency of agressive behaviour in a week. Participants exceeding the threshold had an OAS-m Aggression total score of more than or equal to 3 out of any number with no upper limit depending on the frequency of agressive behaviour in a week. OAS-m Aggression total scores of more than or equal to 3 reflect clinically important aggression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Exceeding Thresholds for the Overt Aggression Scale (Modified) (OAS-m): Irritability Total Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
secondary_outcome.description: The OAS-m contains 3 scales: Aggression, Irritability, and Suicidality. Irritability total score ranged from 0 (no irritability) to 10 (extreme irritability). Participants exceeding the threshold had an OAS-m Irritability total score of more than or equal to 2 out of 10. OAS-m Irritability total scores of more than or equal to 2 reflect clinically important irritability.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Exceeding Thresholds for the Overt Aggression Scale (Modified) (OAS-m): Suicidality Total Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
secondary_outcome.description: The OAS-m contains 3 scales: Aggression, Irritability, and Suicidality. Suicidality total score ranged from 0 (no suicidal tendency) to 16 (extreme/very extreme suicidal tendency). No threshold criterion was determined for OAS-m Suicidality total score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Exceeding Thresholds for the Barratt Impulsiveness Scale - Version 11 (BIS-11): Total Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
secondary_outcome.description: The BIS-11 is designed to assess general impulsiveness taking into account the multifactorial nature of the construct. Total score ranged from 30 (less impulsive) to 120 (more impulsive). Participants exceeding the threshold had a BIS-11 total score more than or equal to 70 out of 120. BIS-11 total scores of more than or equal to 70 could reflect clinically important and potentially pathological impulsivity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Exceeding Thresholds for the Social Dysfunction and Aggression Scale (SDAS): Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: SDAS total scores ranged from 0 (not present) to 44 (extremely severe). Participants exceeding the threshold had a SDAS total score of more than 6 out of 44.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Carbon Monoxide Confirmed Daily Smoking Cessation
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who reported no smoking and no use of other nicotine-containing products since the last study visit (on the Nicotine Use Inventory, which was used to collect the information of cigarette or other nicotine use during the study) and who did not have carbon monoxide of more than 10 parts per million at any time from Week 9 to Week 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With 7-day Point Prevalence of Abstinence (Smoking Cessation)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who reported no smoking and no use of other nicotine-containing products since the last study visit (during treatment) in the previous 7 days and who did not have carbon monoxide of more than 10 parts per million for that observation (if measured).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Number of Cigarettes Smoked Per Day

intervention.description: 1 mg tablets twice daily by mouth (after one week of uptitration: 0.5mg once daily for three days, 0.5mg twice daily for four days)
1 mg tablets twice daily by mouth (after one week of uptitration: 0.5mg once daily for three days, 0.5mg twice daily for four days)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- smokers who smoke >10 cigarettes/day and who have at least a moderate level of addiction as measured by the Fagerstrom Test for Nicotine Dependence (score >5)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any neuropsychiatric disease including depression, history of suicidal thoughts or behavior, bipolar disorder.
- Any unstable medical condition

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 857 participants were screened; 110 participants met the criteria for inclusion into the study and were assigned to study treatment

group.title: Varenicline
group.description: Varenicline 0.5 milligrams (mg) administered once daily (QD) for the first 3 days followed by 0.5 mg varenicline twice daily (BID) for the next 4 days, then 1 mg varenicline BID for the remaining 11 weeks (starting on Day 8, the first day of Week 2)

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo administered QD for the first 3 days followed by placebo administered BID for the remaining 11 weeks and 4 days (starting on Day 4)

group.description: Varenicline 0.5 milligrams (mg) administered once daily (QD) for the first 3 days followed by 0.5 mg varenicline twice daily (BID) for the next 4 days, then 1 mg varenicline BID for the remaining 11 weeks (starting on Day 8, the first day of Week 2)

group.description: Placebo administered QD for the first 3 days followed by placebo administered BID for the remaining 11 weeks and 4 days (starting on Day 4)

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS): Total Score
outcome.description: The MADRS measures the overall severity of depressive symptoms and is a 10-item checklist. Each item was rated on a scale of 0 to 6, for a total score range of 0 (low severity of depressive symptoms) to 60 (high severity of depressive symptoms).

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the Hamilton Anxiety Scale (HAM-A): Total Score
outcome.description: HAM-A measures treatment-related changes in generalized anxiety symptoms and is a 14-item questionnaire. Each item was scored from 0 (not present) to 4 (very severe) and a lower score indicated less affected. Total scores ranged from 0 (not affected) to 56 (very severely affected).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the Overt Aggression Scale (Modified) (OAS-m): Aggression Total Score
outcome.description: The OAS-m contains 3 scales: Aggression (Questions [Q]1 to 4), Irritability (Q5 to 6), and Suicidality (Q7 to 7b). Aggression total score was calculated by summing the weighted scores in Q1 to 4. Scores for each question ranged from 0 (no events) to 5 (very severe events). Total scores ranged from 0 (no aggression) to any number with no upper limit depending on the frequency of agressive behaviour in a week.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
outcome.population: FAS; (n)=number of subjects with data for analysis for varenicline and placebo, respectively.

outcome.description: The OAS-m contains 3 scales: Aggression (Questions [Q]1 to 4), Irritability (Q5 to 6), and Suicidality (Q7 to 7b). Suicidality total score was calculated by summing the items Q7 to 7b. Scores for Q7 ranged from 0 (none) to 6 (very extreme) and scores for Q7a to 7b ranged from 0 (none) to 5 (extreme). Total scores ranged from 0 (no suicidal tendency) to 16 (extreme/very extreme suicidal tendency).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
outcome.population: No change from baseline analysis was performed on the OAS-m Suicidality total score as the majority of observations were recorded as 0.

group.description: Varenicline 0.5 milligrams (mg) administered once daily (QD) for the first 3 days followed by 0.5 mg varenicline twice daily (BID) for the next 4 days, then 1 mg varenicline BID for the remaining 11 weeks (starting on Day 8, the first day of Week 2)

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo administered QD for the first 3 days followed by placebo administered BID for the remaining 11 weeks and 4 days (starting on Day 4)

measure.title: Change From Baseline in the Overt Aggression Scale (Modified) (OAS-m): Suicidality Total Score
measure.description: The OAS-m contains 3 scales: Aggression (Questions [Q]1 to 4), Irritability (Q5 to 6), and Suicidality (Q7 to 7b). Suicidality total score was calculated by summing the items Q7 to 7b. Scores for Q7 ranged from 0 (none) to 6 (very extreme) and scores for Q7a to 7b ranged from 0 (none) to 5 (extreme). Total scores ranged from 0 (no suicidal tendency) to 16 (extreme/very extreme suicidal tendency).
measure.population: No change from baseline analysis was performed on the OAS-m Suicidality total score as the majority of observations were recorded as 0.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the Social Dysfunction and Aggression Scale (SDAS): Total Score
outcome.description: The SDAS contains 11 items with 5 possible responses: 0=not present, 1=doubtful or very mild, 2=mild to moderate, 3=severe, and 4=extremely severe. The SDAS was collected 3 times a day during the inpatient abstinence period (BC). Total scores ranged from 0 (not present) to 44 (extremely severe).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC)
outcome.population: No change from baseline analysis was performed on the SDAS total score as the majority of observations were recorded as 0.

group.title: Varenicline
group.description: Varenicline 0.5 milligrams (mg) administered once daily (QD) for the first 3 days followed by 0.5 mg varenicline twice daily (BID) for the next 4 days, then 1 mg varenicline BID for the remaining 11 weeks (starting on Day 8, the first day of Week 2)

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo administered QD for the first 3 days followed by placebo administered BID for the remaining 11 weeks and 4 days (starting on Day 4)

measure.title: Change From Baseline in the Social Dysfunction and Aggression Scale (SDAS): Total Score
measure.description: The SDAS contains 11 items with 5 possible responses: 0=not present, 1=doubtful or very mild, 2=mild to moderate, 3=severe, and 4=extremely severe. The SDAS was collected 3 times a day during the inpatient abstinence period (BC). Total scores ranged from 0 (not present) to 44 (extremely severe).
measure.population: No change from baseline analysis was performed on the SDAS total score as the majority of observations were recorded as 0.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the Barratt Impulsiveness Scale – Version 11 (BIS-11): Total Score
outcome.description: The BIS-11 is a 30-item self-report questionnaire designed to assess general impulsiveness taking into account the multifactorial nature of the construct. Possible responses to each item were: 1=rarely/never, 2=occasionally, 3=often, and 4=almost always/always. Scores of Items 1, 7, 8, 9, 10, 12, 13, 15, 20, 29 and 30 were reversed when calculating the total score. Total score ranged from 30 (less impulsive) to 120 (more impulsive).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
outcome.population: FAS; (n)=number of subjects with data for analysis for varenicline and placebo, respectively.

group.title: Placebo

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the Minnesota Nicotine Withdrawal Scale (MNWS): Total Score
outcome.description: The MNWS total score contains 9 items (urge to smoke; depressed mood; irritability, frustration, or anger; anxiety; difficulty concentrating; restlessness; increased appetite; difficulty going to sleep; difficulty staying asleep). Each item was rated from 0 to 4 where 0=not at all, 1=slight, 2=moderate, 3=quite a bit, and 4=extreme. Total scores were the average score for all 9 items and ranged from 0 (no withdrawal symptoms) to 4 (extreme withdrawal symptoms).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
outcome.population: FAS; (n)=number of subjects with data for analysis for varenicline and placebo, respectively.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Exceeding Thresholds for the Profile of Mood States (POMS): Total Score
outcome.description: POMS total mood disturbance (TMD) summary results were presented as transformed T-scores ranging from 30 (less disturbance) to 80 (more disturbance). Participants exceeding the threshold had an increase from baseline of 1 standard deviation of the TMD baseline T-score plus 1 or more.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).

outcome.title: Number of Participants Exceeding Thresholds for the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS): Total Score
outcome.description: The MADRS measures the overall severity of depressive symptoms. Total score ranged from 0 (low severity of depressive symptoms) to 60 (high severity of depressive symptoms). Participants exceeding the threshold had a MADRS total score of more than 14 out of 60. MADRS total scores exceeding 14 may represent clinically notable effective symptomatology.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
outcome.population: FAS; (n)=number of subjects with data for analysis for varenicline and placebo, respectively. Statistical analyses were not performed for Period AB due to the small number of participants exceeding the threshold.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Exceeding Thresholds for the Hamilton Anxiety Scale (HAM-A): Total Score
outcome.description: HAM-A measures treatment-related changes in generalized anxiety symptoms. Total scores ranged from 0 (not affected) to 56 (very severely affected). Participants exceeding the threshold had a HAM-A total score of more than or equal to 14 out of 56. HAM-A total scores of more than or equal to 14 may reflect clinically noteworthy levels of anxiety.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Exceeding Thresholds for the Overt Aggression Scale (Modified) (OAS-m): Agression Total Score
outcome.description: The OAS-m contains 3 scales: Aggression, Irritability, and Suicidality. Aggression total score ranged from 0 (no aggression) to any number with no upper limit depending on the frequency of agressive behaviour in a week. Participants exceeding the threshold had an OAS-m Aggression total score of more than or equal to 3 out of any number with no upper limit depending on the frequency of agressive behaviour in a week. OAS-m Aggression total scores of more than or equal to 3 reflect clinically important aggression.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
outcome.population: FAS; (n)=number of subjects with data for analysis for varenicline and placebo, respectively.

outcome.description: The OAS-m contains 3 scales: Aggression, Irritability, and Suicidality. Irritability total score ranged from 0 (no irritability) to 10 (extreme irritability). Participants exceeding the threshold had an OAS-m Irritability total score of more than or equal to 2 out of 10. OAS-m Irritability total scores of more than or equal to 2 reflect clinically important irritability.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).

outcome.description: The OAS-m contains 3 scales: Aggression, Irritability, and Suicidality. Suicidality total score ranged from 0 (no suicidal tendency) to 16 (extreme/very extreme suicidal tendency). No threshold criterion was determined for OAS-m Suicidality total score.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
outcome.population: The number of participants above the threshold for the OAS-m Suicidality total score was not analyzed as the majority of observations were recorded as 0.

measure.description: The OAS-m contains 3 scales: Aggression, Irritability, and Suicidality. Suicidality total score ranged from 0 (no suicidal tendency) to 16 (extreme/very extreme suicidal tendency). No threshold criterion was determined for OAS-m Suicidality total score.
measure.population: The number of participants above the threshold for the OAS-m Suicidality total score was not analyzed as the majority of observations were recorded as 0.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Exceeding Thresholds for the Barratt Impulsiveness Scale – Version 11 (BIS-11): Total Score
outcome.description: The BIS-11 is designed to assess general impulsiveness taking into account the multifactorial nature of the construct. Total score ranged from 30 (less impulsive) to 120 (more impulsive). Participants exceeding the threshold had a BIS-11 total score more than or equal to 70 out of 120. BIS-11 total scores of more than or equal to 70 could reflect clinically important and potentially pathological impulsivity.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline A (Week 0) to Week 2 (Period AB), Week 4 (Period AC), Week 12 or relapse (Period AD), and Week 12 (Period AE). Baseline B (Week 2) to Week 4 (Period BC), Week 12 or relapse (Period BD), and Week 12 (Period BE).
outcome.population: FAS; (n)=number of subjects with data for analysis for varenicline and placebo, respectively.

certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
